sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using LU decomposition
message_1:
Consider the system of linear equations:
$$
\begin{aligned}
 x_1 + 2x_2 + 3x_3 &= 10 \\
 2x_1 + 3x_2 + 2x_3 &= 13 \\
 3x_1 + 2x_2 + x_3 &= 8
\end{aligned}
$$
Use LU decomposition to solve the system of equations and find the values of $x_1$, $x_2$, and $x_3$.
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using LU decomposition, we first need to decompose the coefficient matrix A into a lower triangular matrix L and an upper triangular matrix U.

The given system of linear equations can be represented as:

$$
A\vec{x} = \vec{b}
$$

Where,

$$
A = \begin{bmatrix}
1 & 2 & 3 \\
2 & 3 & 2 \\
3 & 2 & 1
\end{bmatrix},
\vec{x} = \begin{bmatrix}
x_1 \\
x_2 \\
x_3
\end{bmatrix},
\vec{b} = \begin{bmatrix}
10 \\
13 \\
8
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Now, we perform LU decomposition on matrix A:

$$
A = LU
$$

Where,

$$
L = \begin{bmatrix}
1 & 0 & 0 \\
l_{21} & 1 & 0 \\
l_{31} & l_{32} & 1
\end{bmatrix},
U = \begin{bmatrix}
u_{11} & u_{12} & u_{13} \\
0 & u_{22} & u_{23} \\
0 & 0 & u_{33}
\end{bmatrix}
$$

We can find the elements of L and U using the following formulas:

$$
u_{ij} = a_{ij} - \sum_{k=1}^{i-1} l_{ik}u_{kj}, \quad i \le j \\
l_{ij} = \frac{a_{ij} - \sum_{k=1}^{j-1} l_{ik}u_{kj}}{u_{jj}}, \quad i > j
$$

Applying these formulas, we get:

$$
L = \begin{bmatrix}
1 & 0 & 0 \\
2 & -1 & 0 \\
3 & 4 & -1
\end{bmatrix},
U = \begin{bmatrix}
1 & 2 & 3 \\
0 & -1 & -4 \\
0 & 0 & -1
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Now, we solve the following two systems of linear equations:

1. $L\vec{y} = \vec{b}$

2. $U\vec{x} = \vec{y}$

First, we solve for $\vec{y}$:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 0 & 0 \\
2 & -1 & 0 \\
3 & 4 & -1
\end{bmatrix}
\begin{bmatrix}
y_1 \\
y_2 \\
y_3
\end{bmatrix} =
\begin{bmatrix}
10 \\
13 \\
8
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Solving this system, we get:

$$
\vec{y} = \begin{bmatrix}
10 \\
-7 \\
1
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Next, we solve for $\vec{x}$:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 2 & 3 \\
0 & -1 & -4 \\
0 & 0 & -1
\end{bmatrix}
\begin{bmatrix}
x_1 \\
x_2 \\
x_3
\end{bmatrix} =
\begin{bmatrix}
10 \\
-7 \\
1
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Solving this system, we get:

$$
\vec{x} = \begin{bmatrix}
x_1 \\
x_2 \\
x_3
\end{bmatrix} =
\begin{bmatrix}
1 \\
2 \\
-1
\end{bmatrix}
$$

So, the solution to the given system of linear equations is:

$$
x_1 = 1, \quad x_2 = 2, \quad x_3 = -1
$$
